com.wit.android.widget.adapter.module

Class SelectionModule<Item extends SelectableItem,Adapter extends SelectionModule.SelectableItemsAdapter<Item>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wit.android.widget.adapter.module.AdapterModule<Adapter>
      • com.wit.android.widget.adapter.module.SelectionModule&lt;Item,Adapter&gt;
  • Type Parameters:
    Item - The select-able item type.
    Adapter - Type of the adapter for which is this module created.

    public class SelectionModule<Item extends SelectableItem,Adapter extends SelectionModule.SelectableItemsAdapter<Item>>
extends AdapterModule<Adapter>

    Class Overview

    Selection manager for the IMultiAdapter.

    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky

    • Constructor Detail

      • SelectionModule

        public SelectionModule()

    • Method Detail

      • isSelected

        public boolean isSelected(int position)

        Checks if the item at the given position is currently selected.

        Parameters:
        position - Position of the item in the adapter.
        Returns:
        True if the item is selected, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        setItemSelected(int, boolean), toggleItemSelectedState(int)

      • toggleItemSelectedState

        public void toggleItemSelectedState(int position)

        Resolves the select-able item selected state. If the item is selected the flag will be set to false otherwise to true.

        Also adapter will be notified about data set change.

        Parameters:
        position - Position of the select-able item in the adapter.
        See Also:
        setItemSelected(int, boolean)

      • setItemSelected

        public void setItemSelected(int position,
                   boolean selected)

        Sets the given selected state of the select-able item of attached adapter at the given position.

        Also adapter will be notified about data set change.

        Parameters:
        position - Position of the select-able item in the adapter.
        selected - New selected state.
        See Also:
        selectRange(int, int), selectAll()

      • selectAll

        public void selectAll()

        Same as selectRange(int, int), where full range of items of attached adapter will be selected as selectRange(0, itemsCount).

        Also adapter will be notified about data set change.

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If current mode isn't set to MODE_MULTIPLE.
        See Also:
        selectRange(int, int), setItemSelected(int, boolean)

      • selectRange

        public void selectRange(int startPosition,
               int count)

        Sets the selected state to true for the select-able items of attached adapter at the given positions (startPosition, startPosition + count).

        Also adapter will be notified about data set change.

        Parameters:
        startPosition - Position for selection start.
        count - Count of the items to select from the start position.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If current mode isn't set to MODE_MULTIPLE.
        See Also:
        selectAll(), setItemSelected(int, boolean)

      • clearSelection

        public void clearSelection()

        Sets the selected state to false for all select-able items.

        Also adapter will be notified about data set change.

      • clearSelectionInRange

        public void clearSelectionInRange(int startPosition,
                         int count)

        Sets the selected state to true for the select-able items of attached adapter at the given positions (startPosition, startPosition + count).

        Also adapter will be notified about data set change.

        Parameters:
        startPosition - Position for selection start.
        count - Count of the items to select from the start position.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If current mode isn't set to MODE_MULTIPLE.
        See Also:
        selectAll(), setItemSelected(int, boolean)

        Description copied from class: AdapterModule

        Parameters:
        savedState - Saved adapter state.

      • getSelectedItems

        public SparseIntArray getSelectedItems()

        Returns the sparse array with currently selected items positions.

        Returns:
        SparseIntArray with select-able items positions which are in this time selected. Note that this array is sorted for optimization (from lowest to highest position).

      • getSelectedItem

        public Item getSelectedItem(int position)

        Returns the selected item at the given position.

        Returns:
        Item which is at this time selected or null if there is no item selected at the given position.

      • getSelectedPosition

        public int getSelectedPosition()

        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If current mode isn't set to MODE_SINGLE.
        See Also:
        getSelectedPositions()

      • getSelectedPositions

        public int[] getSelectedPositions()

        Returns the array with positions of currently selected items.

        Returns:
        Array with positions of the currently selected items. Note that this isn't necessary sorted array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If current mode isn't set to MODE_MULTIPLE.

      • setMode

        public void setMode(int mode)

        Parameters:
        mode -

      • getMode

        public int getMode()

        Returns:

      • contains

        protected final boolean contains(int position)

        Returns flag indicating if the selected items array contains at the requested position some selected item.

        Parameters:
        position - The position of the item.
        Returns:
        True if the array contains that item, false otherwise.

      • selectItem

        protected final void selectItem(int position)

        Adds the item with given position into array of selected items.

        Parameters:
        position - The position of the item to select.

      • deselectItem

        protected final void deselectItem(int position)

        Removes the item at the requested position from selected items array.

        Parameters:
        position - The position of the item to deselect.

      • getItem

        protected final Item getItem(int position)

        Returns the select-able item at the requested position. Same as getSelectedItem(int).

        Parameters:
        position - Position of the item.
        Returns:
        Select-able item or null if there is no item at the given position.

      • clearSelection

        protected void clearSelection(boolean notify)

        Sets the selected state to false for all select-able items of attached adapter.

        Parameters:
        notify - If set to true adapter will be also notified about data set change.
